summary: Multiple security events detected: brute force attacks on admin endpoints, suspicious API key usage, and potential privilege escalation attempts from compromised service account.

log_snippets.text: Brute force detected: 45 failed attempts for admin@company.com from 185.220.100.240
API key sk-prod-7f8a9b used from unusual location: Belarus (historical: US-East)
Service account 'data-processor' attempted to access admin role permissions
SQL injection attempt blocked: payload '1' UNION SELECT password FROM users--' from 203.0.113.45

findings.description: Coordinated brute force attack targeting admin accounts from multiple suspicious IP addresses.
Production API key being used from unexpected geographic location suggesting potential compromise.
Service account attempting unauthorized privilege escalation, possibly indicating lateral movement.
Multiple SQL injection attempts blocked, indicating active probing of database vulnerabilities.

recommended_actions.action: Immediately revoke API key sk-prod-7f8a9b and investigate account compromise
Block IP range 185.220.100.0/24 and investigate coordinated attack pattern
Rotate credentials for 'data-processor' service account and audit permissions
Enable MFA for all admin accounts and force password reset for admin@company.com
Implement rate limiting on authentication endpoints (5 attempts per minute)
Set up geo-location alerts for API keys used outside normal regions
Review and harden SQL injection protection rules in WAF
